item.title: Splitgate 2 Reveals Impressive Player Base Growth Since Beta
item.description:
Summary

  • Splitgate 2's player base has tripled since the beta, likely due to console success.
  • The game continues to attract many players who enjoy the fast-paced gameplay.
  • Future updates are planned for Splitgate 2 to add more content.

Following its official launch, Splitgate 2 has seen its player base triple since the open beta period. While Splitgate 2 has faced its share of controversy over the last month, it appears that many players are continuing to play the free-to-play shooter from 1047 Games.

On June 6, Splitgate 2 was officially released, marking the end of the open beta period for the game. To celebrate the occasion, 1047 Games CEO Ian Prolux appeared at Summer Game Fest. However, his time on stage was met with controversy due to his “Make FPS Great Again” hat, with some fans unhappy with the choice. Following the incident, Prolux released a post on social media apologizing for the decision, saying he did not intend for his actions to negatively impact the game’s community.

Despite this controversy and others surrounding microtransactions in Splitgate 2 , the game appears to be gaining new players. In a follow-up tweet to Prolux’s apology, the developer revealed that the game has seen impressive growth since the open beta. According to the 1047 Games, the player base has “more than tripled” in size. In addition, the tweet noted that a significant reason for this growth is due to success on consoles. The game is currently available on Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, PS4, PS5, and PC.

Splitgate 2's Player Base Has "More Than Tripled"

While the developer's response did not share an exact player total, Steam gives an idea of how the game has been doing on PC. According to SteamDB data, the game peaked at 25,785 players shortly after its full release. The player count has fluctuated since then, with the concurrent players at 14,665 at the time of writing. However, the influx of players on console means the player base is likely much higher based on 1047 Games' tweet.

It will be interesting to see if Splitgate 2 can stay popular in the months following its full release. The new game looks to build on the gameplay of the original Splitgate by adding new content and evolving existing mechanics. While Splitgate 2 still features portals, many of its systems have been reworked on Unreal Engine 5. For example, the new shooter features factions, each with unique abilities to synergize with teammates. In addition, 1047 Games added new maps, weapons, and modes to the sequel, even bringing a battle royale experience for the game’s full release.

A content roadmap for Splitgate 2 was previously shown, revealing many more updates are expected in the future. These are expected to bring new content, like more maps and power weapons. However, it remains to be seen if this will be enough to outweigh the problems some gamers have with the title.

Portal into the action as an elite Ace in Splitgate 2, the only free-to-play shooter where you can teleport across the map to outsmart your opponents. Team up, customize weapons, and master portaling skills as you compete for glory in epic showdowns.

Evolution Is Here - This is the future of Splitgate, bringing fast-paced portal gunplay with objective-based game modes, distinctive new maps, and a wild collection of weapons.

Win From Any Angle - Dominate the competition with the ultimate tool: a portal gun. Flank your foes and turn the tide of combat by portaling across the map, or defy gravity to launch yourself for jaw-dropping aerial kills.

Team Up and Earn Glory - Recruit your friends and compete for the respect of the entire galaxy. Take control of the Hotzone while your friends hold off enemies portaling in from all sides. Stand together and steamroll your opponents to win the match and claim victory.

Multi-Team Mayhem - Take the action to the next level with the first of our upcoming Multi-Team-Mayhem modes, where 24 players compete in all-out warfare across a massive new map. Chaotic fun is guaranteed.

item.title: How to Complete the Trials of Morgan Myst Quests in Fortnite
item.description:
Players will learn plenty about the Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3 storyline by completing Story Quests, but they can complement this information by doing additional quests called Supernova Academy Quests. The first set of Supernova Academy Quests requires players to help Shadow Blade Hope and Morgan Myst.

This guide will show players how to complete each Supernova Academy Quest in Fortnite so they're able to get through them quickly and earn their well-deserved XP.

How to Complete Shadow Blade Hope Supernova Academy Quests in Fortnite

Players can complete Shadow Blade Hope Story Quests and Supernova Quests in Fortnite . Here is how to do the latter:

Damage Opponents within 5 Seconds of Using Supernova Gear (500)

While 500 may sound like a lot of damage, it can dealt to any type of opponent, making it a much easier task to complete. Gamers can use any hostile NPCs, such as guards and bosses, as well as enemy players, to complete this quest, but not enemy entities, such as Spires.

For the damage to count towards quest progress, gamers need to use any type of Supernova Gear and then deal as much damage as they can within the next 5 seconds. If they use Supernova Gear to deal the damage, then they shouldn't have to worry much about the timer.

Copy the Actions of Morgan Myst's Shadow Proxies to Synchronize Them

How to Find Morgan Myst's Shadow Proxies in Fortnite

There are six Morgan Myst shadow proxies scattered around the Battle Royale island. Players must track three of these proxies and copy their actions to help synchronize them. Here is where players can find the Morgan Myst shadow proxies in Fortnite :

  • Northwest of First Order Base
  • Southeast of Pumped Power
  • Southwest of Shining Span
  • Northwest Lonewolf Lair
  • Shiny Shafts

Once players have found the proxy, they must approach it and mimic its action, which will require them to either crouch or jump .

Check In on the Newly Re-synced Morgan Myst at Supernova Academy

Morgan Myst NPC Location

Next, players need to find Morgan Myst and tell her the shadow proxies have been synchronized once again. Morgan Myst can be found in the basement of the Supernova Academy gym , in the northern part of the location. Players must approach her and select the Greet dialogue option to complete this quest and unlock a bonus Morgan Myst Quest.

How to Complete Morgan Myst Supernova Academy Quests in Fortnite

There are four stages of Morgan Myst Quests in Fortnite , but gamers might be confused about the actual number, as there is a visual bug that sets all of them to Stage 4. Regardless, players get access to the first three stages right away, but in order to receive the remaining stage, they must complete Shadow Blade Hope's Quests.

Assemble Surveillance Gear at Demon's Domain

How to Assemble Surveillance Gear in Fortnite

In the eastern area of Demon's Domain, there is a tall plateau overlooking the lake where players can put down the surveillance gear. First, they must place the device, then attach its parts, and lastly, begin surveillance.

Collect Spire Fragments for Further Analysis (3)

How to Collect Spire Fragments in Fortnite

Next, players have to head to three Scout Spire or Overlord Spire locations and collect fragment pieces. They don't need to engage in combat with the Spire or the guards; they must simply pick up the fragment, and they can leave afterwards.

Deliver the Fragments to Superman for Study

Superman NPC Location

Lastly, players must go to Supernova Academy once again and speak to Superman , who can be found wandering around the building in the southeastern area of the location.

Gather Surveillance Gear At Supernova Academy

How to Gather Surveillance Gear in Fortnite

After completing Shadow Blade Hope's Supernova Academy Quests, gamers will receive this final Morgan Myst Quest. They have to gather surveillance gear that's been placed at Supernova Academy. All of the gear is located in the same building as Superman, but it is on the floor below.

item.title: Helldivers 2's Battle of Super Earth Aftermath Takes Players Out of the Frying Pan and into the Fire
item.description:
Summary

  • After the battle for Super Earth, players are struggling against the aggressive Automatons and Terminids.
  • Players may have trouble adapting to fighting the two factions again after focusing on the Illuminate.
  • To improve combat against Automatons and Terminids, players should adjust difficulty levels and experiment with new equipment.

When it comes to the exciting events that have happened in Helldivers 2 , the battle for Super Earth can be seen as the one that outshines everything. The fight against the Illuminate faction's invasion of the planet provided many with fun and exhilarating moments, but everyone knew that it wouldn't last. The successful defense of Super Earth was inevitable, thanks to the time and effort given by every contributor to reach it. However, with its conclusion also came an unexpected revelation, one that possibly many who continue to play have experienced.

On the day on which the battle for Super Earth concluded, the Illuminate forces were driven back, forcing them to regroup for a potential invasion in the future. With their aggression temporarily halted, players were left with the Automatons and the Terminids to take on, and somehow, it's as if the two are more deadly than ever before. Since there are no known major changes that Helldivers 2 has made to either faction, one would think that they shouldn't be an issue, given that people should be used to dealing with them by now. That doesn't seem to be the case now, and it's likely due to having to suddenly return to engaging them in combat after the Super Earth event.

Why Players Could Be Finding It Hard to Fight the Automatons and Terminids Now

If there's one question that the battle for Super Earth poses after its conclusion, it's how the two factions feel much harder to deal with now than they were before. As for why that seems to be the case for a number of players, it could be because of a few factors:

  • Compared to the more organized chaos that's somewhat expected from battles with the Illuminate, fighting the insect-like Terminids is a relentless assault of aggressiveness, which some may have forgotten since coming back from the battle of Super Earth
  • The Automatons share a similarity with the Terminids in that they can be extremely aggressive but with the advantage of having weapons, potentially throwing off many after getting used to Illuminate's seemingly less chaotic engagements
  • Players may have likely forgotten what equipment to use against the different difficulties of the Automatons and the Terminids after spending a lot of time learning what's best against the Illuminate, making the two seem much harder than they're supposed to be

While what's mentioned is just speculation, they likely possess some degree of truth as to why people are having trouble with the two factions now rather than before. They aren't any harder than they have always been, and players can overcome them so long as they make the effort to adapt back to how they took them on before the battle for Super Earth.

What Players Can Do to Get Used to Fighting the Automatons and Terminids Again

For those who have been having trouble dealing with either faction since stopping the Illuminate invasion, one thing that can be done is to take advantage of the different difficulty levels offered by Helldivers 2 as options. Making the fights easier is something players should consider doing, as it allows them to slowly get used to how the Automatons and Terminids should be dealt with. Not only that, but it's also a good opportunity to try and experiment with new equipment that could make fights against them easier, which can help in diversifying one's loadout and being more prepared for the tougher difficulties.

With the defeat of the Illuminate, the future of Helldivers 2 looks unpredictable, but if one thing is clear, it's that the Terminids and Automatons will still look to try and ruin it. The conclusion of the battle for Super Earth can be seen as a blessing, as it serves as a reminder to players that the two factions are a threat that shouldn't be ignored, and that it's best to learn to deal with them again now, as they could get even stronger in eventual updates.

Do you believe in freedom? Can you stand in the face of oppression – and defend the defenceless? Wage war for peace. Die for democracy.
Join forces with up to three friends and wreak havoc on an alien scourge threatening the safety of your home planet, Super Earth, in this multiplayer co-op shooter for PS5 and PC from Arrowhead Game Studios.
Step into the boots of the Helldivers, an elite class of soldiers whose mission is to spread peace, liberty and Managed Democracy using the biggest, baddest and most explosive tools in the galaxy.
Helldivers don't go planet side without proper backup, but it’s up to you to decide how and when to call it in. Not only do you have a host of superpowered primary weapons and customizable loadouts, you also have the ability to call on stratagems during play.
Helldivers 2 features Arrowhead's best cooperative gameplay yet. Collaboration will be vital: Teams will synergize on loadouts, strategize their approach for each mission and complete objectives together.1
Enlist in Super Earth’s premier military peacekeeping force today. We are heroes… we are legends… WE ARE HELLDIVERS.

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign: How to Get Legendary Weapons
item.description:
Elden Ring Nightreign brings over every weapon from its predecessor, and that includes all of Elden Ring 's legendary weapons. As the name suggests, these are the strongest weapons that you can find in Elden Ring Nightreign . There's no guarantee you'll find one during an Expedition, however, and you may not end up with the best one for your character if you do.

Legendary weapons can be the difference between victory and defeat in Elden Ring Nightreign if you use them correctly, so you should set aside some time at the end of an Expedition to seek them out. They only appear once you're a high enough level, though, so your group won't be able to get any if you fall behind during the first two days of a run.

How to Get Legendary Weapons in Elden Ring Nightreign

Legendary weapons are random drops in Elden Ring Nightreign . Since the game is a roguelike, all of the weapons and equipment you get for beating bosses vary from run to run. Legendary weapons are more likely to be rewarded from tougher bosses at higher levels, though, so you should try to conquer castles and other large POIs during the second day of an Expedition to maximize your chances of obtaining a legendary weapon.

The best way to secure a legendary weapon drop is to slay field bosses once you and your team have reached level 10. Field bosses are marked on the map for easy discovery, and the ones with red borders are particularly powerful. If you take them down, there's a good chance at least one of your party members will walk away with a legendary weapon.

Some Expeditions also give you the chance to upgrade an existing weapon to legendary rarity. When you see a notification about a Shifting Earth event happening in The Crater before an Expedition, a special area will appear that lets you upgrade your weapons to their legendary variants.

At the bottom of the Crater is a special smithing table that upgrades your weapons to legendary rarity. You can only use legendary weapons after reaching level 10, so don't head there too early.

All Legendary Weapons in Elden Ring Nightreign

There are 26 unique legendary weapons to discover in Elden Ring Nightreign :

  • Sword of Night and Flame
  • Marais Executioner Sword
  • Blasphemous Blade
  • Golden Order Greatsword
  • Dark Moon Greatsword
  • Sacred Relic Sword
  • Grafted Blade Greatsword
  • Ruins Greatsword
  • Starscourge Greatsword
  • Maliketh's Black Blade
  • Dragon King's Cragblade
  • Eclipse Shotel
  • Morgott's Cursed Sword
  • Hand of Malenia
  • Winged Greathorn
  • Axe of Godrick
  • Marika's Hammer
  • Bastard's Stars
  • Devourer's Scepter
  • Axe of Godfrey
  • Bolt of Gransax
  • Mohgwyn's Sacred Spear
  • Giant's Red Braid
  • Grafted Dragon
  • Lion Greatbow
  • Carian Regal Scepter

You can check out all of these legendary weapons — and Nightreign 's entire arsenal — in the Visual Codex at the Roundtable Hold. You should also take note of the attribute scaling attached to each weapon so you can decide which Nightfarer in your team is best suited to wield any legendary weapons that drop during your Expeditions.

item.title: This is When You Can Play Ready or Not on PS5 and Xbox Series X
item.description:
Summary

  • Ready or Not will be available on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S on July 15 with full cross-play support.
  • Pre-orders for Ready or Not on consoles start at $49.99, featuring exclusive pre-order bonus weapons.
  • A free update will also be available with new content, including two single-player missions, another new weapon, engine and bug fixes, and more.

Ready or Not developer VOID Interactive confirmed that the tactical first-person shooter is heading to PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S on July 15. Several new details about the console versions of Ready or Not were also revealed alongside a new trailer, with confirmation of full cross-play support.

Released in December 2023 for Steam, VOID Interactive's Ready or Not follows a SWAT team operating in the fictional city of Los Sueños. Ready or Not players can take on a series of realistic breach-and-clear scenarios in some of Los Sueños' most dangerous locations, with friends in online co-op or by themselves in solo play. As the commander of the LSPD SWAT team, players can give tactical orders, plan and carry out missions, and prepare their arsenal for upcoming missions. A year and a half after the initial release, PS5 and Xbox Series X|S owners will finally be able to experience what Ready or Not offers to the first-person shooter genre.

The latest trailer for Ready or Not confirms that the PS5 and Xbox Series X|S versions will launch on July 15, and pre-orders are available now on the aforementioned platforms, starting at $49.99 for the Standard Edition. First-print copies of Ready or Not , known as the Day One Edition, will include three exclusive pre-order bonus weapons: M32A1 Grenade Launcher, MK-V Pistol, and 590M Shotgun. A Deluxe Edition will also be available for $69.99 featuring the base game, the aforementioned pre-order bonus, "Home Invasion" DLC, "Dark Waters" DLC, a third unannounced DLC pack, and the official Ready or Not soundtrack. The pre-order bonus will be made available to PC players through the major free "Stories from Los Sueños" update, which adds new content and full cross-play support with the new PS5 and Xbox Series X|S versions.

Ready or Not is Coming to PS5 and Xbox Series X|S on July 15

The Stories from Los Sueños update will add two new single-player and online co-op missions across the PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S versions of Ready or Not . This is in addition to the 18 missions available right now in Ready or Not , alongside the content featured in the previously released Home Invasion and Dark Waters DLC packs. The new TRPL Pepper Ball Pistol, a Revamped Training Mode, and a difficulty selector feature will also be available at launch.

The Ready or Not developers confirmed that the game will receive various engine updates, system optimizations, and bug fixes for a more stable experience. Players can experience these improvements in the several missions that are already available, along with community-made maps in Ready or Not .
